com.billsbackyardbees.opal.util

Class PasswordAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.billsbackyardbees.opal.util.PasswordAccount
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OpalDataType

    public class PasswordAccount
extends java.lang.Object
implements OpalDataType
    Best to think of this as a java password or account object that corresponds or will correspond to a tuple in the account database.
    Author:
    Quinn Shultz

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PasswordAccount()
      Create a new credential account, may then be populated with a stored account from the database, or completed with new information and stored to the database.

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Description copied from interface: OpalDataType
        All classes that implement this interface are Objects that correspond to tuples in the RDBMS. The id is the primary key of all tables. It has option auto increment so there will not be a java method to set the id.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface OpalDataType
        Returns:
        id and primary key of tuple
